question: A 70-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with complaints of feeling something sticking in his throat, difficulty in swallowing, and weight loss. He also gives a history of regurgitating undigested food 4 to 5 hours after consumption. What is the most probable diagnosis?
What is the extent of the parapharyngeal space?

answers.option: Base of the skull to the epiglottis
Base of the skull to the hyoid bone
Base of skull to lower border of mandible

question: A 50-year-old male smoker presents with a white plaque of approximately 3 cm on the right lateral border of his tongue for the past 1.5 months. The physician suspects it is leukoplakia. Which of the following is the best management plan?
What is the most common cause of Ludwig angina?
What is the most common cause of oroantral fistula formation?

A 40-year-old man presents with the complaint of a swelling on the gums for the past 9 months. It is a soft, smooth, reddish mass that bleeds on touch. He uses a hard toothbrush. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following can a peritonsillar abscess extend posteriorly into?

A 35-year-old man, who has a history of chronic renal failure, comes to the outpatient department with the complaint of a creamy, yellowish-white patch on his tongue for the past 5 to 7 days. He is diagnosed with a fungal infection over his tongue. Which of the following fungi is responsible for his condition?
Which of the following is the gold standard investigation for the diagnosis of sleep apnea?

answers.option: Lateral soft tissue X-ray of neck

question: A 36-year-old female presents to her primary care physician with a complaint of difficulty in opening her mouth for the last 6 months. She has a history of chewing betel nuts for the last 10 years. Examination reveals generalized pale mucosa and fibrosis in the oral cavity with angular cheilitis. She does not have cervical lymphadenopathy. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 17-year-old boy presents to the doctor's clinic with complaints of severe pain in the right side of his throat, severe odynophagia, high-grade fever, trismus, and dribbling of saliva for the last two days. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 21-year-old female presents to the emergency department with complaints of pain in the throat, high-grade fever, ipsilateral earache, and restricted mouth opening. On examination, the patient has bulging of the soft palate and anterior tonsillar pillar of the affected side with congested and swollen tonsil. The trismus accompanying peritonsillar abscess (quinsy) is due to the spasm of which muscle?
'Hot potato voice' is seen in which of the following conditions?

A 65-year-old male presents to your clinic with complaints of foul-smelling regurgitation of undigested food and weight loss for the last couple of months. He often wakes up coughing in the night. What is the most probable cause of his symptoms?

A 10-year-old boy is brought to the clinic because of a 1-week history of pain while swallowing and decreased mouth opening. The boy also has an ongoing dental infection. Oral examination reveals that the tongue is lifted upwards and backward. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old woman is receiving chemotherapy for cancer in the oral cavity. After some rounds of chemotherapy, she starts complaining about decreased salivation. Which statement regarding the physiology of salivation is closely related to this patient's complaint?

answers.option: Salivary secretion is serous in nature
Parotid gland is responsible for about 70% of salivary secretions
Salivary secretion contains the enzyme lipase
About 500 ml of saliva is secreted in 24 hours

question: A middle-aged male is being examined in the ENT outpatient department. He is found to have a non-healing ulcer with a rough surface on the lateral border of the tongue. The ulcer has been there for the past 3 weeks. He has tried a number of topical treatments but they did not have any effect. Loosening of adjacent teeth is also evident. What is your most likely diagnosis?
Which disease is the result of obstruction of the glands on the floor of the mouth?
Where is the sinus of Morgagni located?

answers.option: Between the skull base and the apex of the hyoid bone
Between the thyropharyngeus and the cricopharyngeus
Between the skull base and the superior constrictor
Between the hyoid bone and the floor of the mouth
Between the palatoglossal arch and the palatopharyngeal arch

question: In quinsy (peritonsillar abscess), where does the pus collect?

answers.option: Between the capsule of the tonsil and the superior constrictor muscle
Between the vertebral bodies posteriorly and prevertebral fascia anteriorly

question: A 6-year-old child presents to the clinic with bilateral parotid swelling for the last 5 days. He has also had a fever of 103 °F (39 °C). A diagnosis of bilateral parotitis is made. Family history is positive for similar complaints in a family member a few days ago. What is the incubation period of this disease?
Which of the following is another name for quinsy?

An 18-year-old male presents to the clinic with a diffuse swelling in the submandibular region, fever, ptyalism, and difficulty in chewing. He also gives a history of toothache. On examination, the swelling is diffuse, firm, and brawny with raised floor of the mouth. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old man comes to the clinic with the complaint of sweating over the preauricular sinus whenever he chews food. Several months ago, he had undergone a surgery. Which of the following surgical procedures is most likely to have resulted in this complication?

A 30-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a slow-growing swelling of the left parotid gland for the last 6 years. Fine needle aspiration cytology (FNAC) reveals a parotid tumor. Which of the following is the most common benign lesion of the parotid gland?

A 24-year-old male visits the clinic with a complaint of a swelling in the floor of the oral cavity that ruptures and reappears on and off for the last 2 years. Oral examination reveals a transparent globular cystic swelling in the floor of the mouth. What is the most likely clinical diagnosis?

A 70-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with halitosis and difficulty swallowing. History is also positive for associated weight loss and regurgitation of undigested food. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following is true regarding mucoepidermoid carcinoma?

answers.option: It is treated by radical parotidectomy
Greater the epidermoid component, the more malignant the tumor
It is more aggressive in major salivary glands
It is aggressive and highly metastatic
Greater the mucoid component, the more malignant the tumor

question: A 34-year-old female presents to the clinic with a history of dysphagia to solids for the past 3 years. Her hemoglobin is 7 mg/dl. What will be the most likely finding on a barium swallow?

A 6-year-old boy is brought to the clinic by his mother with complaints of nasal obstruction, nasal discharge, and bedwetting at night. On examination, the boy has an open-mouthed expression with prominent incisors. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A young resident performs an esophagoscopy to remove a foreign body from a 15-year-old boy. One hour later, the patient starts complaining about severe pain between his shoulder blades. Which of the following problems has most likely occurred in this patient?

answers.option: Pressure necrosis from impacted foreign body

question: An 18-year-old male presents to the emergency department with complaints of high-grade fever, thick and muffled voice, odynophagia, saliva dribbling from the angle of the mouth, and ipsilateral earache. On examination, the patient has restricted mouth opening, swelling, and congestion of the soft palate on the right side, uvula pushed to the opposite side, and a red and congested anterior pillar. What will the management plan include?

answers.option: Hospitalization with intravenous fluids, antibiotics, analgesics, and maintenance of oral hygiene
Oral antibiotics now and tonsillectomy later

question: A 25-year-old man swallows a walnut by mistake and comes to the emergency department with the complaint of sudden absolute dysphagia; he vomits whatever he eats. An esophagoscopy is planned. The foreign body is expected to be impacted at one of the three normal anatomical constriction sites which are measured from the upper incisors. What are the distances of these sites from the upper incisors?

A 28-year-old female visits the outpatient department with complaints of restricted mouth opening, burning of the mouth, and intolerance to spicy food. She is habitual of chewing betel nuts for the last 12 years. Which premalignant condition is most likely to be present in this patient?

A 22-year-old girl presents to the clinic with painful ulceration on her lower lip. Examination reveals an 8 mm x 4 mm ulcer with a central necrotic area and a red halo. Which of the following is the most acceptable etiological factor for developing aphthous ulcers?

A 75-year-old lady reports to the emergency department with the complaint of dysphagia to solids following ingestion of her denture. She undergoes esophagoscopy under general anesthesia for removal of the foreign body. Following the removal, she starts complaining about sharp interscapular pain. Which of the following is the most dangerous complication of this procedure?
Which is true regarding pre-malignant lesions of the oral cavity?

answers.option: Erythroplakia is 17 times more malignant than leukoplakia
Lateral border of tongue is the most common involved site in erythroplakia
Leukoplakia is a red erythematous patch
Leukoplakia is more malignant than erythroplakia
Erythroplakia is more common in males

question: A 63-year-old male farmer visits the outpatient department with the complaint of a non-healing right-sided buccal ulcer for the last 2 months. The ulcer is 3 x 2 cm in size. Examination reveals right-sided cervical lymphadenopathy on neck palpation. Which single investigation should be done to establish the diagnosis?

answers.option: CT scan of oral cavity and neck
MRI of oral cavity and neck

question: A 30-year-old male is rushed to the emergency department. He is unconscious and profusely bleeding from the nose. The people who brought him in tell that the man has been in a road traffic accident and suffered trauma to the face. Which of the following should be secured on high priority in such a patient?

A 12-year-old girl is brought to the clinic with complaints of sore throat, coughs, low-grade fever, and malaise for 5 days. Upon general inspection, the child looks ill and lethargic. Vital signs show a temperature of 101 °F (37 °C), a heart rate of 88 beats per minute, and a thready pulse. Oral and throat examinations revealed a thick grey membrane adherent on the faucial tonsils and soft palate. A tongue depressor is used to scrape this membrane resulting in bleeding. Lymph nodes in the jugulodigastric region are palpable. A throat swab is taken and sent for culture. What is the best step in the management of this child's condition?

answers.option: Hospitalization, IV fluids, antitoxin, and emergency tonsillectomy

question: Killian's dehiscence is a potential weak space for the formation of the pharyngeal pouch. Where is it found?

answers.option: Between the glottic and epiglottic folds
Between the thyropharyngeus and cricopharyngeus muscles
Between the palatoglossal and palatopharyngeal arches
Between the base of the skull and the superior constrictor muscle
Between the upper and lower borders of the cricoid lamina

question: A 40-year-old man has a cystic, fluctuant mass of bluish color on the inner side of his lower lip. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A 45-year-old woman who was previously diagnosed with iron deficiency anemia now complains of difficulty in swallowing. What is the most probably diagnosis?

A 65-year-old woman comes to the clinic with a 2-month history of difficulty in swallowing after taking 2-3 bites. She also complains of hearing a gurgling sound on swallowing and regurgitation of food contents at night. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A barium swallow study is used for the evaluation of which of the following conditions?
An elderly man presents to the clinic with complaints of difficulty in swallowing and regurgitation of food contents at night. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 34-year-old woman presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of dysphagia, koilonychia, iron deficiency anemia, and esophageal webs. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the most common malignant mesenchymal salivary gland tumor?
A 4-year-old child ingested a 5 rupees coin. What is the most likely consequence?

answers.option: It will pass into the stool later on
It will get impacted at cricopharynx
It will get impacted at 25 cm
It will get impacted at the esophagogastric junction

question: Carotid artery, jugular vein, upper deep cervical nodes, 9th, 10th, 11th, and 12th cranial nerves pass through which of the following spaces?
Which of the following vertebral levels is the most common site of lodgement of a swallowed foreign body?
Which of the following is true regarding the surface anatomy of the hypopharynx?

answers.option: It extends from the hyoid bone to the level of cricoarytenoid joint
Recurrent laryngeal nerve runs in pyriform fossa
It is the middle part of pharynx
It lies opposite the C3-C4 vertebrae
It has three parts; pre-cricoid region, posterior wall and pyriform fossa

question: Which of the following types of carcinoma is found in Plummer Vinson syndrome?
Which of the following parts of mandible bone is displaced in a temporal mandibular joint (TMJ) dislocation?
A 54-year-old man presents to the outpatient department with a red patch on the mucosal surface and he has a history of smoking. What is your most likely diagnosis?
Which nerve is related to the palatine tonsil at the tonsillar bed?
Which of the following statements is true regarding the parapharyngeal space?

answers.option: It is shaped like a cylinder
It is a closed space and does not communicate with other spaces
The space is divided into two lateral compartments by a fibrous raphe
Extends from the base of skull to hyoid bone

question: Which of the following lymph nodes drains the middle part of the lower lip?
Which of the following is the correct statement regarding the premalignant conditions of oral mucosa?

answers.option: Malignant potential is 17 times higher in erythroplakia than in leukoplakia
Lesion of erythroplakia are mildly dysplastic
The chances of leukoplakia becoming malignant are 50-60%
Leukoplakia is more common in females
Red color of erythroplakia is due to increased keratinization of the submucosa

question: Which of the following disorders of the oral cavity appears as a white, grey covering of the tongue that can be easily wiped off?

A 19-year-old hostel student presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of painful sores in his mouth for the past 2 weeks. Upon inspection, he is found to have pale yellow lesions with a red halo on the floor of the mouth. What is the probable diagnosis?
Which of the following is the recommended treatment for aphthous ulcers?
Which of the following lesion is a pre-malignant condition, characterized by a red patch, usually found on the lower alveolar mucosa, that cannot be easily scraped off?
Which of the following are the first steps of the management of peritonsillar abscess?
Which of the following conditions is characterized by dry mouth due to decreased saliva production?

A 4-year-old child has been brought to the emergency room with a history of coin-ingestion 6 hours back. The child is in discomfort with the inability to swallow even his own saliva. What is the first step in the management of this case?

A 45-year-old malnourished lady is having difficulty swallowing for the past 6 months. Oral cavity examination revealed smooth tongue and fissures at both angles of the mouth. Which of these diagnostic tests are required in this patient?
Which of the following organisms causes acute epiglottitis?
What is the most common site for leukoplakia in the oral cavity?
A 7-year-old child has undergone a tonsillectomy. Just after a few hours of surgery in the ward. He develops bleeding from the operative site. What is the type of hemorrhage?
A 37-year-old man with a history of tobacco chewing presented with painful ulceration in the upper gingiva. The ulcer is surrounded by a keratotic patch at the periphery. What is the diagnosis?

A 62-year-old man came with a squamous cell carcinoma of the cheek on the left side with extension up to the lower gums. What is the most suitable investigation for assessing mandibular involvement in this patient?

answers.option: Plain X-ray face (AP and lateral view)

question: A 34-year-old male patient reported to the outpatient dental department with a chief complaint of oral discomfort, discharge, inability to open his mouth, and bad breath from the past 2 weeks. Intra-Oral examination showed signs of discharge, a white moss-like appearance, ulcerative lesions of the lips, the base of the tongue, buccal mucosa along with bad breath, and fissures at the angles of the mouth. An immediate diagnosis of oral candidiasis was done. Which of the following drugs can be used in the treatment of oral candidiasis?

A 50-year-old male patient has cancer on the lateral border of the tongue measuring 3x2 cm with submandibular nodal involvement of size 3x3 cm. What is the most appropriate treatment option for this patient?

answers.option: Local excision with safe margins and modified radical neck dissection with postoperative radiotherapy
Local excision with safe margins and supraomohyoid dissection
Local excision with safe margins and selective neck dissection

question: A 35-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of dyspnea, easy fatigability, dysphagia, and burning redness around the angle of her mouth. What is the first-line treatment for this patient?

A 9-year-old boy presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of sore throat, fever, and painful swallowing for 2 days. On examination, a grey membrane is seen covering both tonsils. What is the quickest way to confirm the diagnosis?

answers.option: Throat swab for culture and sensitivity

question: A 45-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with a swelling of the lower lip. He has a history of a fall one month back. On examination, the swelling is soft and cystic with a bluish color. What is the likely diagnosis?
In a patient with oral fibrosis and decreased mouth opening, what is the most likely etiological factor?
What is the most common complication of tonsillectomy?
Which one of the following is a cause of Quincy?
Which one of the following is a treatment for acute tonsillitis?

A 59-year-old male presented to the clinic with an area of depression in his mouth that has enlarged over the past six months. On examination, there is a 1.5cm x 0.8cm erythematous area with focal surface erosion on his left buccal mucosa. A biopsy of the lesion shows dysplastic squamous epithelium. Which of the following would be the most likely risk factor for the development of this lesion?

A 30-year-old man presents in the outpatient department with the complaint of several vesicles on his upper lip. He gives a history of a bout of influenza a week back. The vesicles are approximately 0.3 cm with a clear fluid. Which one of the following is the most likely causative organism?

A 23-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a painful swelling in front of his left ear, which was diagnosed as a mumps virus infection. What would be the most likely complication of this condition?

A 59-year-old patient presents to the outpatient clinic complaining of lesions on the oral mucosa. His past medical history is significant for diabetes mellitus. On examination, the lesions on the oral mucosa are grey-white in color and they are scraped off easily leaving behind an erythematous mucosa. What is the likely diagnosis of this patient?

A 67-year-old patient presents with a white patch on the mucosal surface of his oral cavity. The patient has a history of tobacco chewing for 50 years. On examination, the lesion cannot be scraped off. What is the likely nature of this lesion?
Which of the following is the x-ray imaging view of choice for adenoids?

answers.option: Soft tissue lateral view of nasopharynx

question: A 45-year-old male presents with an inability to move his lower lip after a parotidectomy operation. What is the likely injury in this patient?

answers.option: Facial nerve injury at facial canal
Injury of cervical branch of facial nerve
Facial nerve injury at stylomastoid foramen
Facial nerve injury at internal jugular fossa

question: A 22-year-old male complains of recurrent painful ulceration on the tip of the tongue, palate, and inner surface of lips. On examination, a superficial ulcer with a pale center and red periphery is observed. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 6-year-old boy came to the clinic with his mother with complaints of nasal obstruction, nasal discharge, and bedwetting at night. On examination, the patient had an open mouth, a pinched nose, and prominent incisors. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 39-year-old male with a history of tobacco chewing presents with a 4-centimeter-long non-healing wound on his right lateral tongue border. The surface of the wound is irregular and bleeds on touch. What is the gold standard diagnostic test for this lesion?
A 25-year-old male suddenly clutches his neck with both hands during a dinner party. He is unable to produce a voice. What is the first step that should be taken in this case?
A young boy is brought to the emergency department by his parents with a history of ingesting a 2-rupee coin. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial investigation in this case?
Which of the following treatment modalities for tonsillectomy is obsolete nowadays?

A 57-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of sweating and flushing on half her face while eating. She gives a past surgical history of superficial parotidectomy on the same side a few months back. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A young boy from Afghanistan presents with complaints of fever, sore throat, and a grey membrane over his tonsils. How can the diagnosis be confirmed immediately?

answers.option: Throat swab for culture and sensitivity

question: An irritable female patient presents to the clinic with a meat bone stuck in her throat. She has been experiencing absolute dysphagia for the past two days. What is the most appropriate treatment for this patient?
A 15-year-old male presents to the clinic with complaints of high-grade fever and a sore throat. On examination, the spleen is found to be enlarged. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
Which of the following is an example of a mass in the floor of the mouth that is associated with the obstruction of a salivary gland?
What is the investigation of choice for suspected nasopharyngeal angiofibroma?

answers.option: Computed tomography (CT) scan of the base of the skull
Computed tomography (CT) scan of the head with contrast

question: A girl presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of recurrent oral ulcers that are yellow centrally and have an erythema halo. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 4-year-old patient underwent esophagoscopy for obstructed meal bolus and 6 hours after surgery the patient developed severe pain in the interscapular region. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?
A 7-year-old boy presents with a complaint of bilateral deafness. After evaluation, he is diagnosed with a case of enlarged adenoids. What is the typical type of deafness seen in this patient?
Which of the following conditions is often associated with snoring?

A 20-year-old male patient underwent tonsillectomy. One week later, the patient presented with bleeding from the mouth with hematemesis. What is the most common cause of secondary hemorrhage after tonsillectomy?

A 6-year-old boy came with his mother to the outpatient department with a complaint of nasal obstruction, nasal discharge with bedwetting at night. On examination, the boy had an open mouth and, a pinched nose with prominent incisors. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?
